Issues.Title: refactor(common): Use Intl for the number format/pipe
Issues.Body:
We can delegate to Intl the formating of decimals, percents and currencies instead of relying on the Locale data.
When all 3 pipes are used, bundle impact is -7kB. 

Fixes: 
* #33803

Related to: 
* #53907
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(common): Use Intl for the number format/pipe" (#53908)

Issues.Title: refactor(common): Use Intl for the Plural implementation.
Issues.Body:
We can delegate to `Intl` the computation of the plural case instead of relying on the Locale data.

Related to: 
* #53908
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(common): Use Intl for the Plural implementation." (#53907)

Issues.Title: feat(core): Support non-signal reactive callbacks in toObservable
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [x] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [ ] Bugfix
- [x] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->

The rxjs-interop `toObservable` function only accepts `Signal` as an input. The way it is implemented allow any reactive function (function that reads signals) to be accepted, as it uses `effect`. 


## What is the new behavior?

Allow for any reactive function to be passed, and not just a `Signal`. This allows for more flexibility and could be useful in many situations. 
For example - utility functions might return a static value (not a signal) but read signals. That make these functions "reactive", so you can use `effect` (or `toObservable`) to listen to their changes.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No


<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->


## Other information

Please note that there is a workaround for this from the consumer side, which is to use `computed` before calling `toObservable`. However - I think it is less ideal because it creates unnecessary code which hurts readability, and it creates an unnecessary node in the reactive tree.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "feat(core): Support non-signal reactive callbacks in toObservable" (#53900)

Issues.Title: refactor(compiler): extra diagnostics for `@defer` in local compilation mode
Issues.Body:
**Note: this PR is based on PR https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/53901, only the second commit is relevant in a context of this PR.**

This commit adds extra logic to produce a diagnostic in case `@Component.deferredImports` contain types from imports that also bring eager symbols. This would result in retaining a regular import and generating a dynamic import, which would not allow to defer-load dependencies.

Issues.Title: fix(compiler-cli): do not throw fatal error if extended type check fails
Issues.Body:
Currently when the extended type check fails due to an import reference that cannot be generated, the fatal diagnostic is not caught and not properly exposed as a `ts.Diagnostic` that can be gracefully handled. This is inconsistent to non-extended type checking diagnostics.

This is problematic because Angular CLI applications currently fail in obscure ways because:

- the CLI does not expect `getDiagnosticsForFile` to actually throw runtime errors.
- the CLI does not seem to properly print these errors given the parallel workers and build excection, and those errors are especially hard to debug because there is no `stack` for `FatalDiagnosticError`'s.

Example: `MyDir` is not exported and the type check block cannot reference it.

CLI currently will fail with errors like:

```
> ng serve

⠼ Building...
Application bundle generation failed. [3.335 seconds]
✘ [ERROR] Cannot read properties of null (reading 'errors') [plugin angular-compiler]

    node_modules/@angular-devkit/build-angular/src/tools/esbuild/angular/compiler-plugin.js:257:24:
      257 │         if (diagnostics.errors?.length) {
          ╵                         ^

    at /usr/local/google/home/pgschwendtner/projects/test-next/node_modules/@angular-devkit/build-angular/src/tools/esbuild/angular/compiler-plugin.js:257:25
    at async /usr/local/google/home/pgschwendtner/projects/test-next/node_modules/esbuild/lib/main.js:1350:22
    at async Promise.all (index 0)
    at async requestCallbacks.on-start (/usr/local/google/home/pgschwendtner/projects/test-next/node_modules/esbuild/lib/main.js:1348:5)
    at async handleRequest (/usr/local/google/home/pgschwendtner/projects/test-next/node_modules/esbuild/lib/main.js:732:11)
```

cc. @clydin
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(compiler-cli): do not throw fatal error if extended type check fails" (#53896)

Issues.Title: Angular Getting started docs needs to be updated for standalone components
Issues.Body:
### Describe the problem that you experienced

The [Angular Getting Started guide](https://angular.io/start) needs to be updated to reflect the updates for [Standalone Components](https://angular.io/guide/standalone-components).

The Getting Started Guide mentions command like "ng create component cart". This nowadays by default creates a standalone component. That needs to be included in a different way. Not in ngModules as described in the guide.

The Guide sais "The generator automatically added the ProductAlertsComponent to the AppModule to make it available to other components in the application.". But this is not true anymore. The "ng create component <component-name>" command by default creates a standalone component and does not add anything to the `app.module.ts`   The documentation in the guide needs to be updated.

### Enter the URL of the topic with the problem

https://angular.io/start

### Describe what you were looking for in the documentation

The documentation needs to be updated to reflect Standalone Components as created by ng create component by default.

### Describe the actions that led you to experience the problem

Working through the Getting Started Guide. In the provided StackBlitz environment.

### Describe what you want to experience that would fix the problem

The code as shown in the guide should work :-)

### Add a screenshot if that helps illustrate the problem

_No response_

### If this problem caused an exception or error, please paste it here

```true
This is the error message that the angular compiler shows, when you try to include the component as currently described in the Getting Started guide:


Component ProductAlertsComponent is standalone, and cannot be declared in an NgModule. Did you mean to import it instead?
```
```


### If the problem is browser-specific, please specify the device, OS, browser, and version

```true
any browser or OS
```


### Provide any additional information here in as much as detail as you can

```true
It would be very nice if you find the time to update the Getting Started Guide. This would help a lot of Angular Beginners.  THX!
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Angular Getting started docs needs to be updated for standalone components" (#53895)

Issues.Title: inject of ElementRef does not use generic type for the returned type inference
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

Consider the example injection of the `ElementRef` with a specified generic type:

```typescript
  // OK: hostEl is of type ElementRef<HTMLElement>, as expected
  hostElExplicit = inject<ElementRef<HTMLElement>>(ElementRef);

  // KO: hostEl is of type ElementRef<any>, expecting ElementRef<HTMLElement>
  hostElInfered = inject(ElementRef<HTMLElement>);
```

Ideally ` inject(ElementRef<HTMLElement>)` would have the return type of `ElementRef<HTMLElement>`.

The fix is likely around the type definition for the `ProviderToken`.


### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/stackblitz-starters-p38xn9
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "inject of ElementRef does not use generic type for the returned type inference" (#53894)

Issues.Title: Matrix params persist after navigation
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug? router ### Is this a regression? No ### Description When navigating away from a URL that has matrix parameters, the router incorrectly appends those parameters to the end of the new URL. For example for browser URL `https://blah.com/something/or/other;t=12;m=27` there is a component with a routerlink: ```
...
``` When I click the link the browser loads the root, which is then routed to another URL. The redirects are fine, but I end up at the new URL with the matrix parameters still there, e.g. `https://blah.com/another/place;t=12;m=27` ### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug _No response_ ### Please provide the exception or error you saw _No response_ ### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`) ```true Angular CLI: 16.2.6 Node: 16.20.2 Package Manager: npm 8.19.4 OS: linux x64 Angular: 16.2.9 ... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms ... localize, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router Package Version --------------------------------------------------------- @angular-devkit/architect 0.1602.6 @angular-devkit/build-angular 16.2.6 @angular-devkit/core 16.2.6 @angular-devkit/schematics 16.2.6 @angular/cdk 16.2.8 @angular/cli 16.2.6 @angular/material 16.2.8 @schematics/angular 16.2.6 rxjs 7.8.1 typescript 5.1.6 zone.js 0.13.3 ``` ### Anything else? _No response_

Issues.Title: New directive ngRepeat.
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request? core ### Description Sometimes it would be great to quickly repeat elements without writing too much code or importing own directive for that solution. For example for prototyping, layout or whatever. It's a proposal for the build-in directive `ngRepeat`. It's like ngFor but only requires an integer to repeat the element, similar to String.prototype.repeat(n). ### Proposed solution ```html
Hello
``` Output: ```html
Hello
Hello
Hello
``` ### Alternatives considered The existing `ngFor` could handle a number only as overload like: ```html
Hello
``` Output: ```html
Hello
Hello
Hello
``` The idea is to achieve this quickly without having to write own code. For example, test how HTML handles tons of elements (scrolling, responsive, etc) whichout having real data. But this is just one use case.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "New directive ngRepeat." (#53881)

Issues.Title: Make `Router.currentUrlTree` public.
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

router

### Description

I am used to using url trees in my route guards and also when navigating inside my Angular application in general.
Frequently I need the current router state as a `UrlTree`. Current solution is to parse the current url string from state to a url tree as follows: `this.router.parseUrl(state.url)`.

I recently noticed that the Router class actually [has a private `currentUrlTree` getter method](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/packages/router/src/router.ts#L71C3-L73C4):

```
  private get currentUrlTree() {
    return this.stateManager.getCurrentUrlTree();
  }
```

Would it be possible to change this getter to public? Since the method is already there it should not really be a problem to make it publicly available right? Or would there be something against exposing the current url tree to the end users!?

If this feature request is eligible for merging I can make a pull-request.

### Proposed solution

Make the getter `Router.currentUrlTree` public.

### Alternatives considered

Continue using other cumbersome solutions to get the current router state as a `UrlTree`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Make `Router.currentUrlTree` public." (#53884)

Issues.Title: Control flow @for with nested for and mandatory track
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

We have a list of static sections. For each of sections, we loop over a device properties to display their values.
As sections are statics, the nested loop is not re-rendered when we change input item.

```html
@for (section of deviceData.sections; track section.title) {
    <section>
      @for (property of section.properties; track deviceId + '.' + property) {
        <app-section-item ...></app-section-item>
      }
    </section>
  }
```

We have tried to change expression used by track :
```
track deviceId + '.' + section.title
```
but deviceId seems to be not taken into account.

As suggested in blog https://blog.angular-university.io/angular-for/#what-is-the-for-tracking-function, we also tried to just pass the name of a function, without argument (is is an error of the blog and video angular university ?) : 
```html
track itemId
```

```ts
itemId(index, section) {
   return section.title;
}
```

As suggested in doc, we tried full call of a function : 
```html
track itemId(deviceId, section)
```

```ts
itemId(deviceId, section) {
   return section.title;
}
```
but not working.

We tried with "this" to access to device : 
```html
track itemId(section)
```

```ts
itemId(section) {
   return this.deviceId +'.'+ section.title;
}
```
but re-rendered not working

Finally, we generate section id directly in store selector. But I don't understand why : 
- i need to generate an id on section so the inner list is re-rendered
- "this" is not resolved when calling a trackBy method
- any concat method is not resolved dynamically or take care of context and inputs changes

Is there something we missed ?
Thanks for your help.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

_No response_

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 17.0.10
Node: 20.10.0
Package Manager: npm 10.2.3
OS: darwin arm64

Angular: 17.0.9
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router
```


### Anything else?

_No response_

Issues.Title: fix(common): The date pipe should return ISO format for week and week…
Issues.Body:
… year as intended in the unit tests.

This commit makes adds the mention to the doc that it is intended to return a ISO week/week-year (as opposed to a locale based wee/week-year).  

ISO 8601 defines
* Monday as the first day of the week.
* week 01 is the week with the first Thursday

Therefore:
Sunday Dec 31st 2023 is the last day of the last week of the year : W52 2023.

Issues.Body:

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): allow internal Angular compilation control of diagnostic modes
Issues.Body: To support generate diagnostics in varying ways, the internal compilation classes now support a `modes` argument when diagnosing files during a build using the `application` builder. This is not exposed as an option at this time but can be experimented with a build using the `NG_BUILD_TYPE_CHECK` environment variable. This environment variable is not considered part of the public API and may be removed or altered in the future. Its current purpose is to allow profiling of the type checking diagnostics functionality of the build system.

Issues.Title: fix(@angular/cli): fixes Yarn v2 support for registry configuration
Issues.Body:
Adds support for `yarnrc.yml` files so that users of Yarn v2+ who attempt to run `ng add` or `ng update` do not experience a bug where the incorrect registry file extension (.yarnrc) is selected.

Fixes #23448

## PR Checklist

Please check to confirm your PR fulfills the following requirements:

<!-- Please check all that apply using "x". -->

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#-commit-message-guidelines
- [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [x] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)

## PR Type

What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:

## What is the current behavior?
Currently repositories using Yarn v2 or higher do not use the correct registry configuration file format, which causes issues when running ng-cli commands that require access to private repositories. See:
[https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/23448](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/23448)

Issue Number: 23448

## What is the new behavior?

The `ng add` and `ng update` commands check the correct file format (`yarnrc.yml`) for any repositories using Yarn version 2 or higher.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->

Issues.Title: ....ngtypecheck.ts' is not under 'rootDir' '  .../src'. 'rootDir' is expected to contain all source files.
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

16.0.0

### Description

In angular 17, while building a library that imports another library using nx there is a compilation error.

### Minimal Reproduction

npm i
npx nx run data-access-config-objects:build

demo repo- https://github.com/ivegotwings/angularbuildbug

Yes

Most of the websites preferred SSR , optimised and SEO right ? I am super duper excited in angular 17 for SSR but one thing today when I built and deployed on server then SSR are only working in static routes only . 

What I mean by that ?

Issues.Title: Shared assets across locales
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Description

I am using `@angular-devkit/build-angular:application` with `"assets"` and `"localize": true`.

The way these options interact, each locale gets its own separate directory in `./dist/<appName>/browser/<locale>/` and there's no way to place shared assets at the root of the browser directory `./dist/<appName>/browser`.

This means in particular that if I define `"assets": ["./src/favicon.ico"]`, it gets placed at paths such as `/en-US/favicon.ico` and not `/favicon.ico` (this breaks the expected file location).

### Describe the solution you'd like

Shared and localized assets should be differentiated, probably by adding an option to `assetPattern`. This should control if the output is relative to the browser root or localized dir.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

A workaround is to have a manual post-build step to copy the assets, but it's messy.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Shared assets across locales" (#26853)

Issues.Title: fix: ignore custom Jest configuration file and warn if one is found
Issues.Body:
Refs #25434.

Currently with Jest we're experimenting with whether or not Angular CLI can meet user needs without exposing the underlying configuration file. See https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/25434#issuecomment-1610298235 for more context.

If hiding the Jest configuration is a challenge for you, please consider if an alternative approach _without_ hooking into the Jest config is reasonable. Otherwise please post your use case to https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/25434 so we can evaluate the best path forward for this feature.

Jest was incorrectly picking up custom configurations, even though they exist outside Jest's root directory. This commit fixes that behavior so Jest does not see user configurations and does not apply them. Ideally we would throw an error if a Jest configuration is found to be more clear that it isn't doing what developers expect. However they may use a Jest config to run other projects in the same workspace outside of Angular CLI and we don't want to prevent that. A warning seems like the best trade off of notifying users that a custom config isn't supported while also not preventing unrelated Jest usage in the same workspace.

I've noticed a few issues where users were using a custom config either causing a problem or attempting to solve one. I want to be up front during the experimentation process what our current stance is for users playing around with Jest so we can collect feedback on how it impacts users earlier.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix: ignore custom Jest configuration file and warn if one is found" (#26852)

Issues.Title: Allow extract-i18n to only add i18n tags that do not already exist in target translation file
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

_No response_

### Description

As it is now, running extract-i18n is pretty much useless, because once it's run, any consecutive runs will overwrite the translation file entries.

This means, that once run, any new translation tokens added to the project will have to be manually added to all translation files. 

Our use case: we are adding translations to a large site, with 5-8 languages. 
The translation of the project will be a long process, and we cannot add tags to the entire project in one swift move. We have to take it step by step.

However, due to the way extract-i18n works, we cannot use it, as it will just write all i18n tokens found in the code, to the target file.

FWIW, we are using translation files with the JSON format.

### Proposed solution

Add a setting to extract-i18n (for example --no-override ) so that it will not override already existing entries for that ID.


### Alternatives considered

 A) https://github.com/daniel-sc/ng-extract-i18n-merge

Poorly maintained, and only supports XLIFF format.

B) write own script that picks out the translations and adds them to the current translation files (would only work with json). 

C) use other 3rd party runtime translation libraries but we don't want that - we want compile time , as it's much better imho.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Allow extract-i18n to only add i18n tags that do not already exist in target translation file" (#26851)

Issues.Title: Inlining of critical CSS `ng build` optimization
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

~~Inlining of critical CSS is one of the optimizations applied by default when running `ng build`.~~

~~The non-critical CSS should be deferred, i.e. fetched asynchronously.
Here is the Angular implementation for this:~~

```html
<link rel="stylesheet" href="styles.css" media="all" onload="this.media='all'">
```

~~Unfortunately, this stylesheet link will block rendering and its `onload` handler is a no-op.~~
~~I'm wondering if this is intentional or an actual bug.~~

~~The [loadCSS](https://github.com/filamentgroup/loadCSS) project recommends this code:~~

```html
<link rel="stylesheet" href="styles.css" media="print" onload="this.media='all'; this.onload=null;">
```

~~They also have a [blog post](https://www.filamentgroup.com/lab/load-css-simpler/) explaining the logic behind it.~~

### Minimal Reproduction

N/A

_No response_

Issues.Title: Extra configuration possibilities for Native Module Federation with Angular
Issues.Body:
### Command

config

### Description

Is it possible to implement the following feature in esbuild and in angular.json for 'Native Module Federation'?
At this moment I use Angular 17 with 'Webpack Module Federation' and I want to step over to 'Native Module Federation'.

In Angular with 'Webpack Module Federation' you have the configuration option in angular.json to define an extraWebpackConfig. Esbuild does not support such a configuration option.

Why do I need this option?
I want different configuration files for different tasks (e.g. build and serve, e2e).

### Describe the solution you'd like

It would be very useful for my installation for Native Module Federation in Angular 17 to have the configuration option: extraEsBuildConfig in angular.json
I want to use different configuration files for different tasks, such as: build and serve, e2e ect

### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular/cli): change Twitter icon in the application schematic
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist

Please check to confirm your PR fulfills the following requirements:

<!-- Please check all that apply using "x". -->

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#-commit-message-guidelines
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)

## PR Type

What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [ ] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [x] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:

## What is the current behavior?

<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->

Issue Number: N/A

When creating a new project using the `ng new <project name>` command, an **app.component.html** file is generated containing the old Twitter icon.

## What is the new behavior?

<!-- Please describe the new behavior that. -->
The generated file **app.component.html** contains a new Twitter icon in the shape of an X.

Issues.Title: NG_DISABLE_VERSION_CHECK not working
Issues.Body:
### Command

update

### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Launching this command on Angular 8 application is throwing this error :

```
NG_DISABLE_VERSION_CHECK=1 npx --yes @angular/cli@8 update @angular/common@8 @angular/cli@8 --allow-dirty --force --verbose
```

throw this error :
```
The installed Angular CLI version is older than the latest stable version.
Installing a temporary version to perform the update.
Installing packages for tooling via npm.
Installed packages for tooling via npm.
Node.js version v16.19.0 detected.
The Angular CLI requires a minimum Node.js version of v18.13.

Please update your Node.js version or visit https://nodejs.org/ for additional instructions.
```

@angular/cli@17.0.9 is ignoring `NG_DISABLE_VERSION_CHECK` flag inside `ng.js` binary file

### Minimal Reproduction

- Generation of Angular v7 application
- Execute `npx --yes @angular/cli@8 update @angular/cli@8 @angular/core@8`

### Exception or Error

```text
Node.js version v16.19.0 detected.
The Angular CLI requires a minimum Node.js version of v18.13.

Please update your Node.js version or visit https://nodejs.org/ for additional instructions.
```

ng version throws this error ...


Node.js version v16.19.0 detected.
The Angular CLI requires a minimum Node.js version of v18.13.

Please update your Node.js version or visit https://nodejs.org/ for additional instructions.
```
```

_No response_

Issues.Title: bug(mat-sidenav): Focus leaves side-nav if position is set to end
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When using `mat-sidenav` the focus is not trapped in the side-nav if the `position` value is set to "end".

The behavior works properly when the `position` value is not set, or the `position` value is set to "start".

The user's focus is trapped on the first-tabbable element, but when the user continues to use keyboard navigation the focus leaves the sidenav and jumps to the url bar and then behind the side-nav.

### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-dpn6ep?file=src%2Findex.html

### Expected Behavior

The focus should remain trapped in the `mat-sidenav` if the `position` is set to "end" or "start" with all other values remaining the same. 

### Actual Behavior

The focus will leave the side-nav if the `position` is set to `end` with all other values remaining the same. 

### Environment

- Angular: 16
- CDK/Material: 16
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOs
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(mat-sidenav): Focus leaves side-nav if position is set to end" (#28409)

Issues.Title: Backport ripple memory leak fix to LTS
Issues.Body:
Backports an existing fix from 17.0.x to 16.2.x.

The `MatRippleLoader` that is used in the button doesn't track any ripples, but instead patches the ripples onto the DOM nodes which in theory should avoid leaks since the ripple will be collected together with the node. The problem is that each ripple registers itself with the `RippleEventManager` which needs to be notified on destroy so that it can dereference the DOM nodes and remove the event listeners.

These changes avoid the leaks by:
1. Destroying the ripple when the trigger is destroyed.
2. Cleaning up all the ripples when the ripple loader is destroyed.
3. No longer patching directives onto the DOM nodes.

Fixes #28240.

(cherry picked from commit a962bb77f2e68b44e4e3ccf88841f63495661036)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Backport ripple memory leak fix to LTS" (#28408)

Issues.Title: bug(Paginator): Form Field density is not propagated to the Page Size Select Form Field
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

When a different than default (higher) Form Field and Paginator density is applied, the Select Form Field inside the Paginator that serves to select the page size remains to have the same (default) height (42px). 


### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: https://stackblitz.com/edit/iyuv6n?file=src%2Fexample%2Fpaginator-overview-example.html
Steps to reproduce:
1. open the StackBlitz link
2. check last lines of the theme.scss file where the code that is supposed to change the density of the Paginator and Form Field is applied
3. visually compare the heights of the Select Form Field inside the Paginator with the one that is outside the Paginator


### Expected Behavior

For example if `@include mat.form-field-density(-6);` is applied, the Form Fields should have 36px (without the Subscript Wrapper).

### Actual Behavior

The Select Form Field inside the Paginator has 42px height.

### Environment

- Angular: 17.0.0
- CDK/Material: 17.0.4
- Browser(s): all
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): all
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(Paginator): Form Field density is not propagated to the Page Size Select Form Field" (#28398)

Issues.Title: fix(material/core): fix mat-error not rendering with Closure Compiler
Issues.Body:
Fix Closure Compiler issue with <mat-error/>. Fix issue where <mat-error/> does not render.

Existing behavior is that _ErrorStateTracker sometimes reports error state as false when there is an error. This happens because Closure Compiler renames the _ErrorStateTracker's ErrorStateMatcher. The compiler renames all the other implementations of ErrorStateMatcher, but they have different names. Causes the matcher to be null in _ErrorStateTracker. Since ErrorStateMatcher is used as a class in some situations, Closure Compiler is not aware that it is intended to be the same type as the other implementations of ErrorStateMather.

Fix issue by declaring ErrorStateMatcher as an interface. When this commit applied, <mat-error/> will render when built with Closure Compiler.

Googlers: see [internal issue report](b/316413299)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/core): fix mat-error not rendering with Closure Compiler" (#28405)

Issues.Title: bug(form-field): red border-left leaking over .mdc-notched-outline__notch
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

The mat input form label sometimes has a border on the left when the form field is in a error state and is empty so the label is not floating and the hover state is active.

![glitch1](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/25107583/eddb1918-4bf7-4868-bf64-14fe08d76eea)

The border color from:
```
.mdc-text-field--outlined.mdc-text-field--invalid:not(.mdc-text-field--disabled):not(.mdc-text-field--focused):hover .mdc-notched-outline .mdc-notched-outline__leading, 
.mdc-text-field--outlined.mdc-text-field--invalid:not(.mdc-text-field--disabled):not(.mdc-text-field--focused):hover .mdc-notched-outline .mdc-notched-outline__notch, 
.mdc-text-field--outlined.mdc-text-field--invalid:not(.mdc-text-field--disabled):not(.mdc-text-field--focused):hover .mdc-notched-outline .mdc-notched-outline__trailing {
	border-color: var(--mdc-outlined-text-field-error-hover-outline-color);
}
```
With a specificity of `Specificity: (0,7,0)` is taking priority over:
```
.mat-mdc-form-field.mat-mdc-form-field.mat-mdc-form-field.mat-mdc-form-field.mat-mdc-form-field.mat-mdc-form-field .mdc-notched-outline__notch {
	border-left: 1px solid transparent;
}
```
With it's specificity of `Specificity: (0,7,0)`.

The note on the `.mdc-notched-outline__notch` class suggests this is sufficient.
https://github.com/crisbeto/material2/blob/e8b0f416cc714c1922118d7f40b706f37793fb01/src/material/form-field/_mdc-text-field-structure-overrides.scss#L162
```
// Note: class name is repeated to achieve sufficient specificity over the various MDC states.
```

But it may not be. If I add one more `.mat-mdc-form-field`, then the rule's specificity `Specificity: (0,8,0)` is sufficient to bring the style rule above the other, which solves my issue

### Reproduction

I'm having trouble recreating the issue in a stack blitz. I think it is happening due to the order of module loading or the order the scss gets compiled to css, and thus the order that the styles get placed in the DOM. When I try to set it up in a stack blitz, the order of the two rules is reversed. I'm not sure what we could be doing to make the `form-field.mjs` load before the `_form-field-theme.scss`/`_mdc-text-field-structure-overrides.scss`

### Expected Behavior

no border left on .mdc-notched-outline__notch

### Actual Behavior

Some blead through of error-border on .mdc-notched-outline__notch

### Environment

- Angular: 16.2.10
- CDK/Material: 16.2.10 (still an issue after upgrading to 17)
- Browser(s): Chrome  120.0.6099.200 (not an issue on firefox)
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(form-field): red border-left leaking over .mdc-notched-outline__notch" (#28404)

Issues.Title: bug(tabs):  When using "mat-tab-nav-bar" selecting a tab with SPACE will scroll the page
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

This is an issue since at least version 16 and its also present in 17+. I guess it has been there for a long time..

When using "mat-tab-nav-bar" and when hitting SPACE to select a tab, the page will scroll. When using ENTER it works fine.
I guess we should also preventDefault when hitting SPACE?

![mat-tabs](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/78788210/4ed6938a-c18f-4623-83e1-6bbc08ecda2a)


### Reproduction

1. https://material.angular.io/components/tabs/overview#tabs-and-navigation
2. Click "view full example"
3.  Focus one of the tabs and select a tab with arrow keys
4. Hit SPACE to activate a tab



### Expected Behavior

5. Page will not scroll down

### Actual Behavior

5. Page is scrolling down

### Environment

- Angular: 17.0.8
- CDK/Material: 17.0.4
- Browser(s): Chrome 119.0.6045.160 
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10
